item.title: Rensselaer Community Members Encouraged to Integrate Campus Applications with Single Sign-On
item.description: DotCIO strongly encourages the adoption of Single Sign-On (SSO) for all campus-related applications, especially those handling sensitive information. SSO provides centralized visibility and control over client access, making it easier to demonstrate compliance with regulatory requirements such as GDPR, HIPAA, and FERPA.

item.title: Webex Education Connector to Automatically Migrate to Webex LTI Legacy June 2
item.description: Multimedia Services would like to inform the Rensselaer community that the Webex Education Connector used to connect Webex and Blackboard will be automatically migrated to Webex LTI Legacy on Sunday, June 2, 2024. Please refer to the “Authorization Error in LMS Webex Education Connector” ITSSC article for more information if you need to reauthorize the connection.

item.title: Rensselaer at Work Information Session Scheduled for June 7
item.description: Date: Friday, June 7, 2024 12:00 PM - 12:30 PM - Rensselaer at Work Dean Aric Krause, Ph. D., will review the online, project-based graduate degrees and certificates, and participants will learn how RPI Instructor Mentors provide industry expertise, advice, and mentorship in a targeted and experiential learning environment. Please RSVP if you plan to attend!

item.title: Shay Receives IWLCA First Team All-Empire Region Honors
item.description: Midfielder Megan Shay of the Rensselaer women’s lacrosse team has received first team All-Empire Region accolades from the Intercollegiate Women’s Lacrosse Coaches Association (IWLCA). With this first team all-region nod, Megan is now eligible to be named to a national IWLCA All-American team.

item.description: Selmer Bringsjord, Director of the AI & Reasoning Lab at Rensselaer, offers brief comments in this article, which appeared in the May 27 online edition of Outlook.

item.title: How a Tiny Device Could Lead to Big Physics Discoveries and Better Lasers
item.description: Rensselaer researchers have fabricated a device no wider than a human hair that will help physicists investigate the fundamental nature of matter and light. Their findings, published in the journal Nature Nanotechnology, could also support the development of more efficient lasers, which are used in fields ranging from medicine to manufacturing.

item.title: RAF Announces Mary Ellen Mainello’s Retirement
item.description: After more than 25 years of service at Rensselaer, Mary Ellen Mainello will be retiring on June 30. On behalf of the Institute, the Division of Research Administration and Finance would like to take this opportunity to thank Mary Ellen for everything that she has done for RPI, and in particular for the Research Finance division. Please join RAF in congratulating Mary Ellen and wishing her well in her future endeavors!
item.author: Community

item.title: SWE to Host “Arch Away Semester Planning with the CCPD” Workshop
item.description:
Date: Wednesday, June 5, 2024 1:00 PM - 2:00 PM - Worried about landing an internship/co-op for your away semester? Don’t be! The Society of Women Engineers is hosting a workshop on how to explain the Arch program to employers, navigate networking, and use the campus’ career resources to better prepare for your away semester. Don’t miss out on this great opportunity to use Rensselaer’s resources to your advantage!
